channel.title: Bogan Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Bogan Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: Community Events: Toy Drive and Breakfast with Santa
item.description:
Toy Drive at Redlife Coffee (Dec 2-14, 2025): Bring in a new toy and get 10% off your order at Redlife Coffee at the Alexander House, 22 N College Ave, Oxford, OH. Toys will be donated to Talawanda Schools. Partnership with Paris Johnson Jr. Foundation. Visit redlifecoffee.com.

Breakfast with Santa (Saturday, Dec 6, 8-9:30 AM): $5 at the door at Redlife Coffee, 22 N College Ave, Oxford, OH. Includes crepes, hot chocolate, picture with Santa, goodie bag, and chance to win a $25 gift card to Redlife Coffee. RSVP available via QR code on flyer.

Toy Drive at Redlife Coffee

item.title: Holiday Assistance for Bogan Students
item.description:
The community can help Bogan students this holiday season in three ways: - Amazon Wishlist: Purchase items that will be shipped directly to Bogan (QR code available to scan) - Gift tags: Grab a gift tag from the Christmas Tree in the Bogan office - Cash or check donations: Make monetary contributions

Contact Emily, Bogan Social Worker, at 513-273-3403 or whitee@talawanda.org with questions.

View original newsletter

item.title: School Holiday Spirit Week Activities
item.description:
Holiday Spirit Week runs December 15-19, 2025, with themed dress-up days to celebrate before Winter Break: - Monday 12/15: Candy Cane Day (wear stripes or red and white) - Tuesday 12/16: Elf Day (dress like a holiday elf) - Wednesday 12/17: Grinch Day (dress like the Grinch or other movie characters) - Thursday 12/18: Holiday PJ Day - Polar Express Movie Day - Friday 12/19: Holiday sweater day

item.title: Camp Invention Summer Program at Marshall Elementary
item.description:
Camp Invention summer program is coming to Marshall Elementary School (3260 Oxford Millville Road, Oxford, OH) for students entering grades K-6th. The program runs June 8-12, 2026 from 9:00 AM to 3:30 PM daily. Cost is $285 (before discounts), with various promo codes available (save $20-$40 with codes FUN20, FUN25, or TRILESSON). Payment plans available through 4/9/2026. Register at invent.org/claxxv or call 800-968-4332. Sibling discounts are also available at INVENT.ORG/SIBLING.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: RAH Cart Volunteers Needed by PTG
item.description:
The PTG is seeking RAH Cart volunteers to help distribute prizes once a month on Friday mornings. Interested volunteers should email BoganPTG@gmail.com to participate in this monthly recognition program.

View original newsletter

item.title: Food Resources Available for Families
item.description:
Due to uncertainty around SNAP benefits in November, multiple food resources are available to students and families: - Little Free Pantry - Located outside main entrance at Bogan, restocked daily - Backpack Program - Small food bags sent home with students every Thursday - Family Food Boxes - Can be picked up or delivered within 24 hours - Community Pantries - Additional resources linked in the image

For assistance accessing these resources, contact Emily, Bogan Social Worker at 513-273-3403 or whitee@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Lost and Found Reminder
item.description:
The lost and found is filling up with lunchboxes and clothing. Students should check for their missing items, and any unclaimed items will be donated after winter break. Parents are asked to label their child's belongings with their name to help return lost items.

View original newsletter

item.title: Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive for TOPSS
item.description:
Bogan K-Kids is collecting donated food items for the Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive to benefit families served by TOPSS (Talawanda Oxford Pantry and Social Services). Specific items needed include: canned green beans, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, baking mixes, mac & cheese, crispy onions, and hygiene products (shampoo, soap, toothpaste, deodorant, etc.). Donations can be brought to Bogan from October 27th through November 7th. Contact Ms. Currier or Mrs. Bryan with questions.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: November Cafeteria Lunch Account and Menu Information
item.description:
Lunch Account Reminders: - Add funds to student lunch accounts through PaySchool Central - Accounts reaching -$50 will be rolled into school fees; keep accounts current

November Menus: Breakfast and lunch menus for November are now available. November breakfast menu includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast (Nov 3), Stuffed Hash Brown (Nov 10), Bagel Sandwich with Sausage and Cheese (Nov 17), and various options throughout the month. No school on November 24-25 for Thanksgiving break.

item.title: Lost and Found Items Need Claiming
item.description:
The school's lost and found is filling up with lunchboxes and clothing. Students should check the lost and found for missing items, as unclaimed items will be donated after winter break. Parents are reminded to label their child's belongings with their name to help return lost items.

View original newsletter

item.title: Talawanda Spirit Wear Grand Opening Sale
item.description:
The PTG has launched a new Talawanda spirit wear store in addition to Bogan Spirit Wear. The Grand Opening Sale ends October 21, 2025 - save 25% off your order with code SPIRIT303. Available items include t-shirts, hoodies, polos, headwear, backpacks, drinkware, and more. Free shipping on orders over $75. Shop at 1STPLACE.SALE/115858.

item.title: October Lunch Menu and Account Information
item.description:
Parents can add funds to student lunch accounts through PaySchool Central. Accounts that reach -$50 will be rolled into school fees, so please keep accounts current. The October lunch menu is now available, showing daily meal options including items like Mac & Cheese Sandwich Cart, BBQ Chicken Pizza, Popcorn Chicken, Taco Bites, Philly Cheesesteak, and special days like National Apple Day (October 21) and Fall Break (October 17).

View original newsletter

item.title: 5th Grade CogAt Testing Schedule
item.description:
5th graders will take the CogAt test on October 27th, 28th, and 29th. Testing begins after specials at 10:30am each day. Students should arrive on time and be prepared to test. More information about the CogAt test.

item.title: PUSH Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit push-oxford.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Cold and Flu Season Guidelines
item.description:
Cold and flu season has arrived. When to stay home from school: fever of 100°F or higher, frequent/continual coughing or difficulty breathing, diarrhea or vomiting, body rash with fever, active head lice, eye infection with discharge, or sore throat with congestion. When to return: fever-free for 24 hours without fever-reducing medication (ibuprofen or acetaminophen), mild/infrequent cough, tolerating food for 12+ hours, rash improvement, after first head lice treatment, or 24 hours after starting eye drops/ointment. For COVID-19 positive cases, return when fever-free for 24 hours without medication and symptoms are minimal/improving. Call the attendance line when your child is sick, and submit doctor's notes to the front office.

View original newsletter

item.title: 2025-2026 Yearbook Sales Now Open
item.description:
Yearbook sales for the 2025-2026 school year have started early! Order deadline is March 25th. Use Yearbook ID Code: 8480626 to order at ybpay.lifetouch.com. Don't miss capturing a year of memories—scan the QR code or visit the website to place your order.

item.title: Join Bogan PTG on Remind
item.description:
The Bogan PTG is encouraging families to join their Remind group for quick updates, volunteer opportunities, and event reminders sent directly to your phone. Join at: https://www.remind.com/join/boganpt?utm_medium=android - Scan the QR code or use the link to receive timely texts without searching through emails.

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation Event
item.description:
Project Reboot and Talawanda School District present "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. This 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction and how to overcome it, discussing screen time with kids, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot, who has spoken to over 30,000 students and parents and created a TEDx talk with over 2 million views. All attendees will receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. More info at https://projectreboot.school. Grant support provided by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Halloween Celebration and Costume Guidelines
item.description:
Halloween will be celebrated on Friday, October 31st with costumes permitted under specific guidelines: no masks, props, or minimal makeup only, and costumes must be worn to school all day. A costume parade will take place at 9:30am outside (weather permitting) or in the gym if raining, with parents welcome to attend. Classroom Halloween parties will also occur—check with your child's teacher for specific plans, and notify them if you prefer your child not participate.

Halloween Celebration at Bogan
